intro: Cosmibuena arborea, commonly known as the golden tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and private collections.
